content.raw:
Thanks for the fix, @scpeters ! The homebrew jobs now build and there is only one test failure, which is Ign-GUI's fault.

Now Linux and OSX work. Windows will still take a while because of common, I suggest we merge this the way it is so there's at least some CI testing for ign-gui.
content.html:
Thanks for the fix, @scpeters ! The homebrew jobs now build and there is only one test failure, which is Ign-GUI's fault.

Now Linux and OSX work. Windows will still take a while because of common, I suggest we merge this the way it is so there's at least some CI testing for ign-gui.

content.raw:
### Latest status

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gui-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/ (not needed yet)
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gui-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/ :yellow_heart: there is one test failure
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gui-ci-default-trusty-amd64/ (not needed ever)
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gui-ci-default-windows7-amd64/ (needs a way to build ign deps from source, needs C++11...)
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gui-ci-default-yakkety-amd64/ :yellow_heart: due to warnings coming from common
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gui-ci-pr_any/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gui-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/ :yellow_heart: there is one test failure
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gui-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/ (needs a way to build ign deps from source, needs C++11...)
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gui-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/ :blue_circle:
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gui-install-pkg-trusty-amd64/ (not needed ever)

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gui-install-pkg-yakkety-amd64/ (not needed yet)

content.raw:
these four variables are set to true so that we build them from the default branch, correct?

once the default branch version has a release or prerelease package, then we won't need to build them from source anymore?

if so, we should have a TODO comment saying we should use packages when they are available instead of building from source
content.html:
these four variables are set to true so that we build them from the default branch, correct?

once the default branch version has a release or prerelease package, then we won't need to build them from source anymore?

if so, we should have a TODO comment saying we should use packages when they are available instead of building from source

content.raw:
I think we need some special logic to add the following code if gts is in use

~~~
export LIBRARY_PATH=${LIBRARY_PATH}:/usr/local/opt/gettext/lib
~~~
content.html:
I think we need some special logic to add the following code if gts is in use

export LIBRARY_PATH=${LIBRARY_PATH}:/usr/local/opt/gettext/lib

content.raw: this form of \`gpu-reliable-${distro}\` comes from old times when we need to use the same node base system. We can just use `gpu-reliable` , both nvidia nodes are using this label too.
content.html: this form of `gpu-reliable-${distro}` comes from old times when we need to use the same node base system. We can just use gpu-reliable , both nvidia nodes are using this label too.

content.raw: some fixes relatred to the lack of GPU in `ign_gui_fixes`. The Qt5 support for Windows will require of including a configure.bat file (like the one in Gazebo) inside the ign_gui repository. If we need to skip trusty, we need to add conditionals in DSL code not to generate them in the case of distro == trusty an ign_sw == ign_gui.
content.html: some fixes relatred to the lack of GPU in ign_gui_fixes. The Qt5 support for Windows will require of including a configure.bat file (like the one in Gazebo) inside the ign_gui repository. If we need to skip trusty, we need to add conditionals in DSL code not to generate them in the case of distro == trusty an ign_sw == ign_gui.
